did.abstract: The collection contains the administrative records, correspondence, legal documents, fliers, notes, and publications of the Storrs Draft Information Committee. The records contain information associated with draft counseling, draft resistance, non-violent protest, peace movement groups, and selective service at the University of Connecticut during the Vietnam War.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Storrs Draft Information Committee was a draft counseling center located at the Storrs Community House on North Eagleville Rd. The draft counseling center was intended to help assist men of draft age during the Vietnam War with options to avoid military service, if possible. The primary source of aid came from information surrounding immigration to Canada.
